title: Protocol studies using LLM role-playing framework

d
deftab720tightenfactor0

Tue, 16 Sept 25\

d
deftab720tightenfactor0

Meeting Overview\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Martin Harrigan introducing protocol studies for computer science/blockchain educators\
• Teaching fellow at SETU (Southeast Technological University, Ireland)\
• Goal: integrate protocol studies into blockchain/decentralized systems curriculum\
• Interactive workshop using LLMs to analyze protocols\

d
deftab720tightenfactor0

Protocol Studies Introduction\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Expanding definition from narrow cryptography protocols to broader social/institutional protocols\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Traditional: Diffie-Hellman key exchange (Alice & Bob calculations)\
◦ Broader: handshakes, dinner parties, community protests, international trade agreements\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Similar evolution to blockchain term - from technical data structure to broader assemblage\
• Spectrum from micro to macro scale protocols\

d
deftab720tightenfactor0

LLM-Powered Protocol Analysis Pipeline\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Transcribed entire Summer of Protocols YouTube channel (80 videos, 720k words)\
• Extracted foundational ideas using embeddings and clustering\
• Generated aggregated concepts with labels:\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Layering, complexity, foundations, agency clusters\
◦ Identified conflicts within concepts (e.g., academic funding vs innovation)\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Output: 76KB JSON file (13k tokens) for LLM context\

d
deftab720tightenfactor0

Framework for Protocol Evaluation\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Based on Unreasonable Sufficiency of Protocols paper\
• 10 properties of good protocols:\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Constraints\
◦ Generative\
◦ Learnable\
◦ Legible\
◦ Duly extrovertible\
◦ Defensible\
◦ Evolvable\
◦ Mortal\
◦ Legitimate\
◦ [10th property not clearly captured]\

d
deftab720tightenfactor0

LLM Role-Playing Exercise Structure\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Load protocol studies context into preferred LLM\
• Choose protocol with ~2 roles (avoid complexity)\
• Create character prompt for LLM to embody one role\
• Demonstrate typical flows, then test specific properties\
• Use conversation steering to reveal protocol characteristics\

d
deftab720tightenfactor0

Demonstration: Kevin the Dinner Host\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• LLM plays dinner party host, user plays guest\
• Tested defensibility: locked bathroom, LLM found neighbors restroom solution\
• Tested mortality: future scenario where eating obsolete, LLM suggested alternative social gathering\
• Meta-prompting technique: have LLM create its own character prompt\

d
deftab720tightenfactor0

Framework Strengths & Weaknesses\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Strengths:\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Good coverage of technical and social dimensions\
◦ Cross-domain applicability\
◦ Tight feedback loop for rapid iteration\
◦ Real-time human-computer augmentation\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Weaknesses:\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Circular reasoning (good protocols survive, analyze survivors)\
◦ Vague sufficiency criteria - no quantitative measures\
◦ Limited to specific instantiations vs protocol classes\
◦ LLM sycophancy makes adversarial testing difficult\

d
deftab720tightenfactor0

Exercise Results & Discussion\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Participants chose protocols: parenting, academic processes, etc.\
• Role confusion noted - giving LLM entire protocol vs collaborative participation\
• LLMs know more than they can articulate directly - simulation surfaces latent knowledge\
• Potential for multi-agent scenarios removing humans from loop entirely
